result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua M Kafura was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Case 14CF1141 was dismissed and read into: 14CF1008.

Filed by the Defendant inquiring if he qualifies for good time credit on his revoked sentence.

Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Joshua M Kafura in court, in custody, with attorney Douglas M. Bihler.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1 and Ct. 3 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
- 6 months jail straight time - 83 days credit -  STAYED for 18 months Probation
- Court Costs of $343.00 (includes DVsurcharge) to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.   Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Anger management. It's up to the Agent's discretion as to the contact of the defendant with the victim - Karissa H. .
- 30 days Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 11, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 11, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Plea/sentencing hearing on November 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua M Kafura in court, in custody, with attorney Douglas M. Bihler.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests bail be modified to reflect NO Violent contact with Karissa H. State objects. Court denies the motion to modify bail in any way, shape or form. Defense requests a different date in 30 days for plea and sentencing. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.
